questions.question: Correct the sentence: "The dog ate his food, he threw up."

choices.answer: The dog ate his food. He threw up.
He dog ate his food he threw up
The dog ate his food, he threw up.
The dog ate his food therefore he threw up.

questions.question: Correct the sentence: "I want pizza for dinner, I'm going to order some."

choices.answer: I want pizza for dinner, I'm going to order some.
I want pizza for dinner so now I'm going to order some.
I want pizza for dinner, so now I'm going to order some.
I want pizza for, dinner I'm going to order some.

questions.question: What is one way to correct a comma splice?

choices.answer: Take out the comma.
Replace the comma with a dash.
Don't do anything.
Replace the comma with a period.

questions.question: What is one way NOT to correct a comma splice?

choices.answer: Swap the comma with a semicolon.
Add a coordinator after the comma.
Take out the comma and leave it as one sentence.
Add a subcoordinator in the beginning of the sentence.
the use of a comma to join two independent clauses
Something english teachers made up.
2 or more independent clauses w/out appropriate punctuation
pieces of sentences that disconnected from the main clause

questions.question: Correct the sentence: "I forgot my money at home, I can't buy lunch."

choices.answer: I forgot my money at home I can't buy lunch.
I forgot my money at home, I can't buy lunch.
I forgot my money at home; I can't buy lunch.
I forgot my money at home. I can't buy lunch.
